fr.xephi.authme.security.crypts

Class BCryptHasher

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.xephi.authme.security.crypts.BCryptHasher

  • public class BCryptHasher
extends Object
    Wraps a BCrypt.Hasher instance and provides methods suitable for use in AuthMe.

        public static boolean comparePassword(String password,
                                      String hash)
        Verifies that the given password is correct for the provided BCrypt hash.
        Parameters:
        password - the password to check with
        hash - the hash to check against
        Returns:
        true if the password matches the hash, false otherwise

      • generateSalt

        public static String generateSalt()
        Generates a salt for usage in BCrypt. The returned salt is not yet encoded.

        Internally, the BCrypt library in BCrypt.Hasher#hash(int, byte[]) uses the following: Bytes.random(16, secureRandom).encodeUtf8();

        Because our EncryptionMethod interface works with String types we need to make sure that the generated bytes in the salt are suitable for conversion into a String, such that calling String#getBytes will yield the same number of bytes again. Thus, we are forced to limit the range of characters we use. Ideally we'd only have to pass the salt in its encoded form so that we could make use of the entire "spectrum" of values, which proves difficult to achieve with the underlying BCrypt library. However, the salt needs to be generated manually only for testing purposes; production code should always hash passwords using EncryptionMethod.computeHash(String, String), which internally may represent salts in more suitable formats.

        Returns:
        the salt for a BCrypt hash
